column1: No authors that the critics recommended have ever received acknowledgment for a best-selling novel.
No soldiers that the diplomats supported have ever shown bravery in the controversial war.
No ambassadors that the diplomats consulted have ever seen brutality in the foreign war.
No professors that the students respected have ever wanted negativity in a class debate.
No customers that the salesmen assisted have ever expressed optimism for a full refund.
No comments that the politicians ignored have ever caused bitterness toward the liberal newspapers.
No detergents that the housewives used have ever caused damage to the delicate clothing.
No lawyers that the businessmen respected have ever received criticism for a bad trial.
No students that the teachers punished have ever expected friendliness from the strict principal.
No babysitters that the children obeyed have ever expected gratitude from the disappointed parents.
No actors that the fans recognized have ever experienced soreness after a dangerous stunt.
No teachers that the parents recommended have ever caused problems for the new students.
No students that the librarians helped have ever made progress on the difficult assignment.
No nurses that the doctors appreciated have ever shown patience in the operating room.
No criminals that the policemen caught have ever felt satisfaction from a petty crime.
No employees that the managers recommended have ever wanted kindness from the rude customers.
No accountants that the managers trusted have ever seen rises in the quarterly profits.
No candidates that the voters supported have ever shown friendliness to the rude journalists.
No surgeons that the patients trusted have ever seen appreciation from the hospital staff.
No suspects that the witnesses identified have ever shown nervousness in the court room.
No actresses that the housewives admired have ever caused excitement at a film festival.
No ambassadors that the government consulted have ever received hostility from the liberal media.
No politicians that the journalists endorsed have ever earned trust from the rural communities.
No teenagers that the parents trusted have ever expressed kindness to a younger sibling.
No survivors that the medics treated have ever felt courage during the extreme emergency.
No players that the coaches drafted have ever felt nervousness before a championship game.
No dictators that the citizens trusted have ever caused chaos at a public event.
No professors that the students understood have ever experienced tiredness after a long lecture.
No actors that the judges nominated have ever had luck at the award ceremonies.
No actresses that the directors auditioned have ever shown elegance on a large stage.
No champions that the competitors defeated have ever shown humility after a big game.
No paintings that the collectors liked have ever depicted tranquility with very bright colors.
No editors that the journalists respected have ever had patience for a missed deadline.
No teenagers that the teachers motivated have ever experienced loneliness in the large class.
No students that the professors tutored have ever had trouble in a math class.
No movies that the children watched have ever depicted gore during a fight scene.
